etymology.description: 大 (big; great) + 安 (peace) + 区/區 (district) = “Great Peace District,” i.e., Da’an District.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “Great Peace District,” naming an administrative district of Taipei City. “大安” conveys an auspicious sense of great peace and well-being.
etymology.simplification: 區 was simplified to 区 in PRC character simplification to reduce strokes; 大 and 安 are unchanged. Taiwan uses the traditional form 大安區.

examples.chinese: 我们今天去台北的大安区散步(我們今天去臺北的大安區散步)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen jīntiān qù Táiběi de Dà'ān Qū sànbù.
examples.english: We’re going to take a walk in Taipei’s Da’an District today.

examples.chinese: 大安区有许多餐厅和咖啡馆(大安區有許多餐廳和咖啡館)。
examples.pinyin: Dà'ān Qū yǒu xǔduō cāntīng hé kāfēiguǎn.
examples.english: Da’an District has many restaurants and cafés.

examples.chinese: 搭捷运到大安站很方便(搭捷運到大安站很方便)。
examples.pinyin: Dā jiéyùn dào Dà'ān Zhàn hěn fāngbiàn.
examples.english: Taking the metro to Daan Station is very convenient.
